NEW YORK , Oct. 19, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- CipherHealth was awarded the No. 2 spot on Modern Healthcare's eighth annual Top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare list. This marks the second year in a row the New York City -based healthcare technology firm ranked in the Top 5. CipherHealth shares the list with healthcare providers, insurers, and suppliers nationwide. 
Each year, Modern Healthcare ranks leading organizations with high levels of employee satisfaction and success in the healthcare field. Taking various factors into account when determining its rankings, including employee satisfaction, workplace culture, and work-life balance, Modern Healthcare conducts a thorough exploration of each organization by surveying all employees of the companies under consideration. The firm also conducts in-depth interviews with company leaders. 
New York City is known for its status as a healthcare technology hub with many innovative companies working to solve healthcare's largest problems. CipherHealth is proud to represent New York City on this list among other elite healthcare organizations. 
Randy Cheung , CipherHealth's co-founder, said, "It speaks to the passion and dedication of our team that we were able to rank this highly on the list multiple years in a row. We are practicing the same things we work with our clients on, increasing transparency, accountability, and open communication. As our team grows both in volume and scope, we have seen continued success by staying true to the values that made us great early on." 
CipherHealth's tools have helped hospitals and other healthcare organizations reduce avoidable readmissions, improve patient satisfaction, and enhance the quality of care since 2009. Beyond benefiting patients, the tools CipherHealth offers lead to higher levels of staff satisfaction. Nurses at one 877-bed hospital in Michigan reported a 21 percent increase in their perception of making a positive impact on patient care and a 52 percent increase in their ability to disseminate critical information to patients throughout the day. CipherHealth's solutions have also been successfully implemented in regional hospitals. Notably, Saint Elizabeth Medical Center in Utica, N.Y. reported a 75 percent reduction in readmissions of chronically ill patients after the implementation of Voice, CipherHealth's post-discharge outreach tool. 
CipherHealth's suite of digital solutions demonstrates how technology can successfully close gaps in communication, identify issues before they lead to readmissions, and uncover improvement areas in a healthcare setting, and the company is proud to join this list of other leading healthcare organizations. CipherHealth hopes to reach over 10 million patients in 2016. 
To view the full list of Modern Healthcare's Best Places to Work in Healthcare 2015, click here .
